thread.title: CLIPPERS: Crawford back where he belongs
thread.title_full: CLIPPERS: Crawford back where he belongs - Press Enterprise

author: JANIS CARR
title: CLIPPERS: Crawford back where he belongs
text:
By JANIS CARR / Orange County Register
Published: Sept. 30, 2015 Updated: 3:02 p.m. CLIPPERS: Crawford back where he belongs Print Photo Share Pin It More Galleries ADVERTISEMENT Clippers' Jamal Crawford attacks the basket against Spurs' Manu Ginobili during a playoff game last season. Following an uncertain summer, Crawford begins his fourth season with the Clippers as one the team's top reserves. ED CRISOSTOMO/STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER Related article » PLAYA VISTA Living in New York and playing for the Knicks taught Jamal Crawford an important lesson.The veteran guard learned not to listen to off-season chatter, especially if your name is linked to trade rumors.
Crawford was left wondering if he still would be playing for the Clippers this season as rumors of his departure hit social media, including his own Twitter timeline. In one tweet this summer, Crawford suggested a follower “ask Doc” whether he would be on the Clippers this season.
While Crawford said the off-season was stressful, he was ready for whatever was headed his way. Turned out, he didn’t go anywhere. He begins his fourth season with the Clippers as one the team’s top reserves.
“That time (in New York) prepared me for this,” he said. “It’s a business and in a day, you can only control what you can control and worry about how you can get better.”
Crawford said he sought advice from several teammates including Chris Paul, Blake Griffin and DeAndre Jordan.
“Those three guys… those are the only guys we were here three years ago and I guess if I wasn’t supposed to be here, I wouldn’t be here,” Crawford said.
